metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

connectorUiConfig.title: JumpCloud (using REST API)-Preview
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [JumpCloud](https://jumpcloud.com) connector allows you to easily connect your JumpCloud organization events to Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector uses the [JumpCloud REST API](https://jumpcloud.com/api) to fetch logs and supports DCR-based ingestion time transformations that parse the received data and ingest into custom table(JumpCloud_CL) in your Log Analytics workspace.

dataTypes.name: {{graphQueriesTableName}}

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

Read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key)

customs.name: JumpCloud REST API Key
customs.description: Enable API access in JumpCloud and generate API Key. Please refer to JumpCloud official [documentation](https://jumpcloud.com/api) for more information.

customs.name: JumpCloud Organization Id
customs.description: Obtain your JumpCloud organization id to fetch events. Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://jumpcloud.com/api) to obtain the Organization Id using the JumpCloud API Key obtained in previous step.

instructionSteps.description:
Currently, this connector allows to ingest events from the following [JumpCloud REST API](https://jumpcloud.com/api) endpoint: 
 1. [Get Organization Events](https://jumpcloud.com/api) 
>This connector parses events into JumpCloud_CL Table.
instructionSteps.title: Connect JumpCloud events to Microsoft Sentinel

columns.name: timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of when the event occurred (UTC).

columns.name: correlation
columns.description: Details for a background process or parent event that can be used to correlate related events.

columns.name: resource
columns.description: Resource that changed or attempted the login.

columns.name: system_group
columns.description: string that contains the closest device/system group involved in the event.

columns.name: system
columns.description: The string that describes the system.

columns.name: target_resource
columns.description: Target resource involved in the event.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: Event type.

columns.name: useragent
columns.description: User agent information for the browser that submitted the request.

columns.name: auth_method
columns.description: Session = console, api-key = api-key.

columns.name: geoip
columns.description: Geo IP information for the IP address that made the request.

columns.name: mfa
columns.description: Denotes whether MFA was used on an authentication attempt.

columns.name: mfa_meta
columns.description: string that contains metadata around MFA authentication such as the type of MFA.

columns.name: eventType
columns.description: Type of the event

columns.name: provider
columns.description: The org ID of the provider if the org is a provider org.

columns.name: success
columns.description: Denotes whether a login attempt was successful.

columns.name: message_chain
columns.description: Results detail for each event.

columns.name: error_message
columns.description: Error details.

columns.name: idm_client_id
columns.description: The client ID for the Identity Management integration.

columns.name: application
columns.description: Information for the application that the event was initiated for.

columns.name: auth_context
columns.description: string for authentication context including factors used, device information, and policies applied.

columns.name: service
columns.description: Service that the event originated from.

columns.name: organization
columns.description: Organization that the user belongs to.

columns.name: association
columns.description: string that describes a change in association, such as adding a user to a group.

columns.name: client_ip
columns.description: IP address that the request came from.

columns.name: initiated_by
columns.description: string that describes who initiated the request.

columns.name: changes
columns.description: List of changes made in the request. You cannot search on the contents of this field.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique ID for the event

columns.name: category
columns.description: Category of alert

columns.name: severity
columns.description: Severity of alert.

columns.name: username
columns.description: Username provided for the alert service call.

columns.name: user_agent
columns.description: User agent information for the browser that submitted the request.

columns.name: version
columns.description: The schema version for the document object.

columns.name: idp_initiated
columns.description: Returns true if the request was initiated from the Identity Provider (JumpCloud). Returns false if the auth was initiated from the service provider.

columns.name: nas_mfa_state
columns.description: Disabled: No MFA required. Enabled: MFA is required if the user is configured for MFA. Required: MFA is required unless the user is excluded and not configured for MFA. Always: MFA always required.

columns.name: auth_type
columns.description: Authentication type.

columns.name: eap_type
columns.description: EAP type.

columns.name: outer
columns.description: Object for outer.

columns.name: system_timestamp
columns.description: Local system time.

columns.name: message
columns.description: Log message associated with a login attempt.

columns.name: src_ip
columns.description: IP address the login request came from.

columns.name: process_name
columns.description: Process that initiated a login attempt.

columns.name: app_management_source
columns.description: The JumpCloud method of configuring and installing the application.

columns.name: windows_meta
columns.description: Information about Windows authentications including whether the login had elevated privileges and the logon type.

columns.name: connection_id
columns.description: Unique id for every LDAP connection.

columns.name: operation_number
columns.description: All operation requests and operation result pairs are given incremental operation numbers beginning with operation_number=0 to identify the distinct operations being performed.

columns.name: dn
columns.description: Distinguished name (DN) provided for authentication.

columns.name: mech
columns.description: The authentication method used. Either simple or SASL.

columns.name: start_tls
columns.description: The starttls protocol that was used to open the LDAP connection.

columns.name: tls_established
columns.description: The LDAPS protocol that was used to open the LDAP connection.

columns.name: error_code
columns.description: Result code.

columns.name: oid
columns.description: LDAP object identifier.

columns.name: base
columns.description: The base of the subtree in which the search is to be constrained.

columns.name: scope
columns.description: The search scope. This specifies the portion of the target subtree that should be considered.

columns.name: deref
columns.description: The alias dereferencing behavior, which indicates how the server should treat any aliases encountered while processing the search.

columns.name: filter
columns.description: The filter criteria for the search with the scope.

columns.name: attr
columns.description: A set of attributes to be returned to the client.

columns.name: number_of_results
columns.description: Number of rows returned from the search.

columns.name: auth_meta
columns.description: Object for authentication context including factors used, device information if cert was present, push device information if JumpCloud Protect was a factor, and policies that were applied.

columns.name: mdm_type
columns.description: The type of MDM service.

columns.name: device_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the device.

columns.name: device_manager_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the device manager.

columns.name: windows_device_uuid
columns.description: Unique ID for the windows device.

columns.name: command_uuid
columns.description: Unique ID for the command.

columns.name: request_type
columns.description: The type of command.

columns.name: command
columns.description: The executed command.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The command result: Acknowledged, Error, CommandFormatError, and Idle.

columns.name: error_chain
columns.description: Raw error details as reported by the MDM device.

columns.name: result
columns.description: Description of the end result of the event

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the notification channel.

columns.name: description
columns.description: The description of the notification channel.

columns.name: channel_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the notification channel.

columns.name: config
columns.description: The configuration of the notification channel.

columns.name: referrer_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the referrer.

columns.name: referrer_type
columns.description: The type of referrer.

columns.name: object_storage_item_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the object storage item.

columns.name: object_storage_item_version_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the object storage item version.

columns.name: object_storage_item_version_name
columns.description: Name of the object storage item.

columns.name: object_storage_item_version_size
columns.description: Size of the object storage item's version in bytes.

columns.name: object_storage_item_version_sha_256_sum
columns.description: Object storage item version's SHA-256 sum.

columns.name: total_software_item_count
columns.description: Total count of object storage items with a SOFTWARE_APP referrer type for the organization.

columns.name: total_space_used
columns.description: Total sum of object storage items.

columns.name: system_object_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the system associated with the request.

columns.name: detail
columns.description: Log message associated with an alert event.

columns.name: pid
columns.description: Partner ID of the MSP.

columns.name: access_request_id
columns.description: Access request ID.

columns.name: workflow
columns.description: Workflow object with id name type and description.

source
| extend 
 TimeGenerated = timestamp | extend Type="JumpCloud_CL"

connectorUiConfig.title: JumpCloud (using REST API)-Preview
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [JumpCloud](https://jumpcloud.com) connector allows you to easily connect your JumpCloud organization events to Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector uses the [JumpCloud REST API](https://jumpcloud.com/api) to fetch logs and supports DCR-based ingestion time transformations that parse the received data and ingest into custom table(JumpCloud_CL) in your Log Analytics workspace.

dataTypes.name: {{graphQueriesTableName}}

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

Read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key)

customs.name: JumpCloud REST API Key
customs.description: Enable API access in JumpCloud and generate API Key. Please refer to JumpCloud official [documentation](https://jumpcloud.com/api) for more information.

customs.name: JumpCloud Organization Id
customs.description: Obtain your JumpCloud organization id to fetch events. Follow the steps in the [documentation](https://jumpcloud.com/api) to obtain the Organization Id using the JumpCloud API Key obtained in previous step.

instructionSteps.description:
Currently, this connector allows to ingest events from the following [JumpCloud REST API](https://jumpcloud.com/api) endpoint: 
 1. [Get Organization Events](https://jumpcloud.com/api) 
>This connector parses events into JumpCloud_CL Table.
instructionSteps.title: Connect JumpCloud events to Microsoft Sentinel

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

Testing JumpCloud Solution

Data Connectors: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
